## Deferred class

Promise wrapper that allows to manipulate it more easily by making `resolve` and `reject` accessible outside the usual callback.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Deferred<T> 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [promise](./utils.deferred.promise.md) |  | <code>Promise&lt;T&gt;</code> |  |
|  [reject](./utils.deferred.reject.md) |  | <code>(...args: any[]) =&gt; void</code> | Rejects the promise. |
|  [resolve](./utils.deferred.resolve.md) |  | <code>(...args: any[]) =&gt; void</code> | Resolves the promise. |
